This is simple enough, use the settings override function. See this section=

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#overrides in the User=

Manual for more on how they work, but basically it lets you override most
=
settings on a per host basis. In your instance, you would create an overrid=
e
for the troublesome site and modify the robots.txt behavior for it.
 
- K=
ris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mail=
to:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Jay
Sent: 27. okt=F3ber 20=
05 06:36
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Dif=
ferent Robots Honoring in One Job


Hello Everyone,

I am wondering whether=
 is there any way that I can have different robots.txt
honoring policy 
in =
one job.  Since I have several urls that I wanted to crawl but one of the
u=
rl is disallowing /
images/ directory with robots.txt, but I wanted to craw=
l the images.  At the
same time, I don't 
want to ignore other urls' robots=
.txt.  Also I don't want to separate the
url in different job.  

Any thoug=
hts?

Thx,
Jay
